title: New Item "Phase boots:
body: thought it might be nice to have boots that negate unit collision like a phantom dancer, obviously some champs PA isn't viable but having  no collision with units would be nice, It could be an activation on the boots to use the no unit collision or it could be a permanent passive effect  and like the rest of the boots 45 + movement speed.

replies.body: Or you could just have it as a boot enchantment

This is needed right now!! and this picture shows why, i was yasuo and i physically couldnt get to my ally to help him, my champ just waked up and down the minion wave, similarly Rengar couldnt get out and thus died. tbh it was BS

Phase Boots would be core on Assassins and ADCs I think. 
They need to get in and get out/reposition during fights really well and would be great on them. 
The cost though. If it's more than {{item:3006}} then might not be core on ADC.

I talked about this a while ago with friends. Our conclusion was it should simply be added to the passive of Swifties. {{item:3009}} Probably the most under-bought boot type.

Also with slows recently changed to no longer stack, swifties took an indirect minor nerf.

Swiftness is pretty strong on some fighters. Adding that new effect would make swiftness the most OP boots of all League history. 

I'd say Ionian boots is the most under-bought item.
I think it's an alright idea, doesn't really fit on any champion though due to other boots being more attracting.

I think PD is a niche for champions like jinx who don't have a lot of mobility to begin with to be able to escape better (or yi to chase better). Especially since 80% of mages have bonkers mobility and huge burst to go with it... giving this to them will hurt adc's more then you know.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TvbpQx-dQfQ&index=4&list=RDYZKN73_0xtI

lel, think about it

I can see it being useful, but at the same time it would make certain champs like Fizz who normally don't have unit collision able to easily get Alacrity or Homeguard while causing the opponent to luck out with needing the enchantment to be able to avoid unit collision.

I do however think there should be an AP item that gives the same passive as Phantom Dancer.
